definition: to resemble/to be like/to look as if/such as/appearance/image/portrait/image under a mapping (math.)

sentences.english: That man has reversed Genesis- man has make God to his image and likeness.
sentences.chinese: 人卻本末倒置，以自己的形像塑造天主。

sentences.english: For in the image of God made he man.
sentences.chinese: 因爲神制人是照自祭閱形像制的。

sentences.english: From the beginning, digital technology was used to create new kinds of images.
sentences.chinese: 從一開始，數碼技術就被用來創造新的形像。

sentences.english: and put on the new self, created to be like God in true righteousness and holiness” (NIV).
sentences.chinese: 這新人是照着神的形像造的，有真理的仁義和聖潔。

sentences.english: This is because God designed you, in his image, to live for eternity.
sentences.chinese: 因爲神原是照着他自己的形像造人，要人活到永恆。

sentences.english: It is another to believe the iconographic misfire means very much.
sentences.chinese: 相信形像失敗意味着很多是另一件。

sentences.english: Attila the Hun decorated his battle helmet with the figure of one. —Mel White
sentences.chinese: 匈奴王阿提拉就以一隻蒼鷹形像裝飾他戰鬥的頭盔。

sentences.english: Common folk had only vague notions of their own image in the broad sense.
sentences.chinese: 平頭百姓對自己的形像只有模糊的廣義上的概念。

sentences.english: There he was transfigured before them.
sentences.chinese: 就在他們面前變了形像。

sentences.english: Stamp Thine own image deep in my heart.

definition: variant of 憤怒|愤怒[fen4 nu4]
Guanyin, the Bodhisattva of Compassion or Goddess of Mercy (Sanskrit Avalokiteśvara)
lit. to descend to earth (of an immortal)/to be born
Guanyin, the Bodhisattva of Compassion or Goddess of Mercy (Sanskrit Avalokiteśvara)
living spirit, living image (idiom); true to life/vivid and realistic
